English language file for FlowframTk messages. https://github.com/nlct/flowframtk GPL-3.0 Nicola Talbot
{0} [<options>] [<file>] ...
{0} Enable debugging. {0} Enable experimental features.
Settings may be overridden by any JDR/AJR files that are loaded.
{0} Show the grid. {0} Enable grid lock. {0} Show the toolbars. {0} Show the status bar. {0} Show the rulers. {0} <type> Set the paper size to <type> where <type> may be a keyword, such as a0, or in the form: user <width> <height>. \meta'{'type'}' {0} Disable the request for printer attributes on startup.

Click at each vertex. Double-click on final vertex to close path. Drag corner points to distort object. Click on control point to select a segment. Click on centre point, move mouse and click to complete. Grid lock on Grid lock off Loading {0} Modified Image has been modified Image hasn't been modified Storage unit Click on "new image" button or select File->New to start To restore a frame, click on its icon Click at each vertex. Double-click on final vertex to finish path. Click at first corner, move mouse and click on opposite corner to complete. Saving {0} Click on path to select. Control-click to add to selection. Double click to select path underneath. Shift click to remove from selection. Click at start point to obtain cursor. Click at start point to obtain cursor.

JDR/AJR versions 1.8 and above can now store the bitmap location either as an absolute path or a path relative to the saved file.
Your current application settings will use the path as specified in the ''{0}'' box.
Your current application settings will use a relative path.

Create Path from SVG
Create Path
Unit: Unit:
Enter the path data (as per the SVG path "d" property) in the box below. For example: M 100 100 L 300 400 Z. Select the unit of measurement and click on the {0} button to create a draft path. (The current styles will be added to the path when it''s added to the canvas.) The unit should correspond to the SVG data. The co-ordinates will be converted to the current storage unit while the SVG data is parsed. You will need to reparse the SVG data to make the change in unit take effect. Are you sure you want to abandon the changes you have made to the SVG data?

Edit Text Text in LaTeX file Same S Different D Re-Map M Text Path attributes Left Delimiter L Right Delimiter R The delimiters can''t be set to \ '{' '}' or + and should not appear in the LaTeX equivalent text except where their use is as a text path decoration delimiter. The delimiters should in general have category codes 11 or 12. See "/pgf/decoration/text format delimiters" in the pgf manual for further details.

Change Font Font N Sample Samples Font Family Y Font Series R Bold Medium Font Shape P Italic Upright Font Size Z SansSerif Anchor A Horizontal Anchor Setting A Vertical Anchor Setting V Left Center Right Base Bottom Center Top The LaTeX fonts are a rough guide. Text displayed in LaTeX pgfpicture environments may differ significantly from those displayed in flowframtk. The position of the anchor is displayed as a red dot in the sample panel.

JDR/AJR Settings J When saving: V Save all canvas settings Don't save canvas settings Only save paper size When loading: A Apply all settings stored in the file Ignore any settings stored in the file Only apply paper settings stored in the file Warn when loading old JDR version W
Bitmaps B Default bitmap settings Use relative paths for bitmaps R Default LaTeX Command: L
Application Paths P Set the paths to applications used by some export functions LaTeX L PDFLaTeX F DVIPS D DVISVGM V libgs G Time-out: M Milliseconds
Storage Unit Storage Unit: U If you change the storage unit, all coordinates in the current frame will be converted to the new storage unit. This may take a while if you have a large or complex image, so it's generally best to set the storage unit before you start your image. The storage unit is independent of the grid unit. Some settings, such as line width or font size, are independent of the storage unit.
TeX/LaTeX Settings T Configure TeX/LaTeX settings
Document Settings G Settings that control the font sizes and class Normal Font Size N Set LaTeX normal font size settings Remember to set this as the default font size in your document, e.g: Update all LaTeX font size declarations in current image U Use default class D Use class: S Use relative font size declarations R Add \pdfinfo to exported LaTeX documents I Use typeblock as bounding box for pgfpicture T

Default Preamble Modify contents of preamble.tex file P This is the contents of the file "{0}". If you have modified it outside of this application whilst this application is running, click on the reload button to refresh the contents. This code is used when exporting to LaTeX documents, PDF, PostScript and SVG formats, but is not used when exporting to other formats, including export to .cls or .sty files. Reload R Reload preamble file

Invalid hexadecimal number ''{0}'' (row ''{1}'', column ''{2}'')
Normalization M Due to the varied nature of display units, 1 inch (or 72 PostScript points) displayed on the screen at 100% magnification may not actually measure 1 inch if you hold a ruler up to your screen. You can compensate for this by setting the horizontal and vertical normalization factors. If you already know these factors you can type them into the boxes below (or set them both to 1 to remove normalization): or you can hold your ruler up against the unnormalized horizontal and vertical lines, enter their measurements in the boxes and click on the 'Compute' buttons below. X Normalize Factor: N Y Normalize Factor: Y Compute X Norm P Compute Y Norm T Reset E Unnormalized Horizontal Unnormalized Vertical Invalid length ''{0}'' Normalized Lines
TeX Editor X Change UI settings for the internal TeX editor The (La)TeX editor is used by the edit preamble function and the edit frame contents function. Some of these settings require a restart to take effect. Font: F Font Size: Z Static/Dynamic Frame Contents Editor Preferred Size Default Width: W Approximate number of characters per line Default Height: F Approximate number of lines Syntax highlighting Y Comment color E Control Sequence color Q Canvas/Preamble Split Left of Canvas N Right of Canvas S Above Canvas B Below Canvas V
Look & Feel K Change the look and feel of the widgets A restart is required for these settings to take effect. Sample buttons don't perform any actions when you click on them. They just demonstrate their appearance. The "Plain" icon styles aren't suitable for L&F styles that don't place a border around toggle and radio buttons. Look & Feel Name: N General Button Styles Dialog Button Styles Style Sample Buttons Press Toggle Radio Default Small Plain Highlights Bordered Switches Small Plain Small Highlights Small Bordered Switches Highlight Icons and Trailing Text Plain Icons and Trailing Text Bordered Icons and Trailing Text Highlight Icons and Leading Text Plain Icons and Leading Text Bordered Icons and Leading Text Highlight Icons and Top Text Plain Icons and Top Text Bordered Icons and Top Text Highlight Icons and Bottom Text Plain Icons and Bottom Text Bordered Icons and Bottom Text Text Only T As General Button Style Default Text Only Large Icons and Trailing Text Small Icons and Trailing Text Large Icons and Leading Text Small Icons and Leading Text Large Icons and Top Text Small Icons and Top Text Large Icons and Bottom Text Small Icons and Bottom Text Small Bordered Icons and Bottom Text Small Bordered Icons and Top Text Small Bordered Icons and Leading Text Small Bordered Icons and Trailing Text
Select Application Select path to application P Please specify location of ''{0}'' application Setup You need to check some settings before you continue with this function. If these are correct, click on the 'Okay' button to continue. Please specify the location of the libgs library. (Leave empty if you want to use the LIBGS environment variable.) The file will probably be called something like libgs.so (Unix-like) or gsdll32.dll (32-bit Windows) or gsdll64.dll (64-bit Windows)

Line Detection Delta Threshold: D Merge Spike Length Threshold: Merge Spike Neighbor Threshold: Fixed line width: Set line width to the given value Relative line width Set line width to twice the average delta round round to nearest positive integer Detect intersections Variance Threshold: V Wedge Threshold: W Wedge Length Threshold: Spike Return Distance: K Minimum stub length: B Tiny Step Threshold: Y
Smooth Shapes Tiny Step Threshold: T Smoothing will try to replace a sequence of segments with a longer segment. The tiny step threshold indicates the upper bound for the length of each segment in the sequence.The sequence will stop either when a segment is found that is too long or if a third bend (maximum/minimum) is detected. Points of inflection aren't detected. Longer segments may be replaced if the entire sub-path can be approximated by a quadrilateral or ellipse. Length Threshold: L Length Threshold and Threshold Diff: If the best line is shorter than the Length Threshold, then the best line longer than this length will be selected if the delta (deviation) for the longer line is less than the delta for the shorter line plus the Threshold Diff value. Threshold Diff: D Max Deviation: X
If a path has delta (deviation) that's larger than Max Deviation, it won't be used. The deviation is calculated as ��/�� where �� is the number of points in the sequence and �� is the area of �� XOR �� = (�� ∪ ��) ∖ (�� ∩ ��) where �� is the shape formed by closing the polygonal sequence and �� is the shape formed by closing the fitted curve/line. Deviation Diff: If bends (maxima/minima) are detected, then an attempt will be made to fit lines joining the sequence start to the mid point of the bends and to the end of the sequence. If the average delta (deviation) for line fits using bends as end points is ≤ best delta + Deviation Diff, then these lines will be chosen. Try Bézier curves In addition to trying to fit lines to the sequence of tiny segments, if the ‘Try Bézier curves’ check box is selected, the smoothing task will also try fitting cubic Bézier segments. The Nelder-Mead method is used to find the best fit. Curve Sampling It can take a long time to try fitting a curve to every sub-sequence. Sampling can significantly reduce the time taken but it may not find the best match. Flatness Threshold: If a curve is too flat, the best line will be chosen instead. The flatness is the maximum distance of a control point from the line connecting the end points. Threshold Diff: If both a possible line and curve have been found (that satisfy other criteria), the curve will be chosen if the curve delta is less than the line delta plus the Threshold Diff, otherwise the line will be chosen. Minimum points: P Curve fitting will only be attempted if the sequence of tiny segments has at least Minimum Points. Stationary Point Threshold: If the best curve doesn't fit any detected bends (maxima/minima) then a longer curve that fits one or both bends will be chosen where the bend deviation is less than this value, provided other restrictions are satisfied (such as flatness and maximum deviation). Note that points of inflection aren't detected. Nelder-Mead Simplex Parameters Alpha (�� > 0): Reflection co-efficient Gamma (�� > 1): Expansion co-efficient Rho (0 < �� ≤ 0.5): Contraction co-efficient Sigma (0 < �� < 1): Shrink co-efficient Epsilon (�� > 0): Termination threshold Maximum iterations (> 0): Stopping criteria to prevent process running on for too long.

Select the required tasks (scanning must always be done initially) and click on the "Do Selected Task" button (green circle). Click and drag mouse over bitmap to select area. Use SHIFT to add to current scan region and CTRL to exclude area. Click on the required area of the image to set the foreground color to that of the target pixel.

Welcome <h1>Welcome to {0} version {1}.</h1> Here are a few pointers:<ul><li>Use SHIFT ESC to abandon a path under construction<br>(This has changed from JpgfDraw.)</li><li>Use the {2} dialog to set the storage unit.<br>({3}->{4})</li><li>Use the {5} dialog to enable/disable hotspots.<br>({6}->{7})</li><li>The export to PS/PDF/SVG functions all use LaTeX, so you need to have TeX installed to use them.</li><li>Make sure you have at least version 1.16 of flowfram.sty if you want to use the export to .cls or .sty functions.</li><li>The preamble editor is now in a pane attached to the side of the canvas.</li><li>If your operating system supports drag and drop, you can drag image files onto {0}''s internal desktop (the gray background of the main window) to open the images in separate windows or you can drag and drop onto the canvas (in select mode only) to add the file contents to the current image. You can also drag and drop text onto the canvas in select mode or in text or maths mode.</li></ul>See the manual for further details.
